projects.title: Participated in FashHack Australia
projects.description: From 19 to 21 June 2015 I took part in FashHack, the first fashion tech hackathon in Sydney. This was my first hackathon and I delivered my first elevator pitch. Together with two other team members I worked on ‘SpecTec’: 3D printed frames, based on a 3D scan of your face, to ensure each pair of glasses fit your unique bone structure. But on top of that we also provide a concierge service to recommend frames that match your personality and style. Both online and in pop up stores.

projects.title: Organised the first annual DH Benelux conference
projects.description:
The first DHBenelux conference on 12- 13 June 2014 showcased the state of the art in digital humanities – the most recent development in humanities research. For researchers already involved in digital humanities, the conference proved to be a great opportunity to share knowledge and meet potential project partners. For those new to digital humanities, the conference provided a platform to get acquainted with both experienced and beginning researchers.

As project manager for this event, my responsibilities included planning and controlling, time and budget management, administration and archiving, planning (social media) marketing strategies, and collaboration with external suppliers/speakers/participants. Starting up the organisation's Twitter-account I accumulated over 100 followers within the first two months. The total amount of participants was close to 170.

Reviews:
Albert Meroño-Peñuela
- http://www.cedar-project.nl/digital-humanities-benelux-conference-report/

Ulrike Wuttke
- http://ulrikewuttke.wordpress.com/2014/06/28/dhbenelux2014/

Heidi Elaine Dowding
- http://www.thegloballibrarian.com/62/
- http://dixit.hypotheses.org/277

Max Kemman
- http://www.maxkemman.nl/2014/06/grasping-technology/

Stef Scagliola for Historici.nl
- http://www.historici.nl/nieuws/verslag-een-digital-battle-den-haag-benelux-2014

Merisa Martinez
- http://merisamartinez.wordpress.com/2014/06/20/and-now-for-something-completely-different-dh-benelux-and-the-freedom-of-digital-humanities/

projects.title: Organised the opening of the conference and exhibition 'The Woman, 1813-1913-2013'
projects.description:
Organised by the Royal Netherlands Historical Society (KNHG) in The Hague, the ‘The Woman, 1813-1913-2013’ conference took place in The Hague. Over 180 people attended the opening of the conference and the exhibition that occurred at the same time.

The Kingdom of the Netherlands celebrated it's 100th birthday in 1913. Women's organisations seized the opportunity to organise a major exhibition: 'The Woman, 1813-1913'. The exhibition showed what women contributed to culture, economy and society, but it also dealt with abuse through domestic labour  and raised the issue women were seen as second-class citizens. In 2013, the Kingdom of the Netherlands again celebrated a centenary. In the past century, women gained the right to elect and be elected, to employment and economic independence and equal control in relationships. The lectures during the conference 'The Woman 1813 - 1913 - 2013' were linked to the themes of the exhibition of 1913.
HRH Princess Beatrix attended the opening of the conference, hence continuing a tradition: her great-grandmother, grandmother and mother were present at the opening of the exhibitions on the historical development of the position of women in 1898, 1913 and 1948.

I was responsible for organising the opening ceremony, for which planning and controlling were my main tasks. This included keeping regular contact with the different stakeholders: the conference organisation, the venue and HRH Princess Beatrix' team.

contributors.headline: Project Manager Operations at Traffic Builders | Digital Marketing Intelligence

projects.title: Organissed the annual European Society for Textual Scholarship (ESTS) conference
projects.description:
The ninth conference of the European Society for Textual Scholarship will be an international academic forum for communication between different approaches to historical and literary source editing. Edited source texts, documents and databases are essential to literary, political, historical scholarship, as well as to social studies, art history, music, philosophy or theology. The conference aims at bringing together academics working in disciplines that have so far worked within independently operating scholarly traditions, promoting innovative, multidisciplinary exchange and dialogue. The conference will examine the transformation of traditional editorial practice into a digital environment and the creation of innovative opportunities like the use of digital tools and media. 

The conference lasted for three days, in three different locations and attracted over 100 participants. As project manager I was reponsible for the full organisation of the event: planning, administration, time and budget management, keeping in close contact with different stakeholders.

contributors.headline: Project Manager Operations at Traffic Builders | Digital Marketing Intelligence

profile_positions.description:
After almost 2 years working on client projects I was promoted to Project Manager Operations. In this role, I'm responsible for the project administration at Traffic Builders. I'm also responsible for part of the invoicing.

While maintaining the day-to-day operations, I aim to optimize these processes; using my experiences as a consultant and working client-side. 
* creating a smooth(er) project administration process that works well for our roughly 60 consultants
* while providing relevant and accurate insights for our managers
* and resulting in timely invoicing to our clients
profile_positions.title: Project Manager Operations

profile_positions.description:
As Project Manager Digital Marketing in a digital marketing agency, I have a dual role. On one hand I’m responsible for stakeholder management: building and maintaining excellent working relations, explaining strategical decisions and providing additional information (either upon request, or proactively). On the other hand I provide the marketing consultants on my project team with the necessary project details, as well as any relevant context, allowing them to excel at their job. Keeping track of budget management and other project administration is my responsibility as well. 

I thrive when I can create calm in chaos and when I can use my interpersonal skills to build trust and understanding. As a person who’s all about open communication, I like to celebrate project and team wins as much as personal wins, but I don’t shy away from difficult conversations – if needed. I believe that if there’s a strong foundation, stakeholder management is a delicate dance of giving and taking. 

Traffic Builders (founded in 2001) is a data driven, full funnel digital marketing agency with a passion for result driven digital marketing and sales, based in Almere - The Netherlands. Our mission is to help clients with ambition to realize their digital marketing & sales objectives. Traffic Builders has been ten times selected as one of the best e-business companies in the Dutch Emerce100 Awards.

profile_positions.location: University of Western Sydney Parramatta North Campus
profile_positions.description:
Digital Humanities is the annual international conference of the Alliance of Digital Humanities Organizations (ADHO) and was held in Sydney, Australia, 29 June–3 July 2015.

DH2015 is hosted by the University of Western Sydney’s Digital Humanities Research Group, a leader in collaborative digital humanities in the Asia-Pacific region. The conference is held in partnership with the State Library of New South Wales and in collaboration with GovHack 2015 and the third International Linked Open Data in Libraries, Archives, and Museums Summit (LODLAM).
profile_positions.title: Member of the Local Organising Committee

profile_positions.description:

•	Member of the communication team. Tasks included general PR, social media and webcare.
•	Webshop-administrator (corresponding with customers and supplier, making invoices, keeping inventory).
•	Administrator of the institute's research information system Metis.
•	Former agent for external IT-helpdesk: day to day intermediate for the helpdesk and institute employees, as well as managing hard- and software migrations.
•	Used to participate in the project group about the merging of two institutes concerning office computerization and housing: implementing new soft- and hardware. Plan and coördinate internal relocations.
•	Used to participate in the project group about the merging of two institutes concerning internal- and external communications.

(former Huygens Instituut - KNAW)

volunteer_experiences.description:
Stichting Limmen Ludiek is a non-profit organisation which aims to showcase a positive presentation of the community of Limmen through a much talked about event.

The 2015 Guinness World Record attempt was made possible by well over a thousand volunteers and over 42.000 manhours. Together they created a 180,96 m2 mosaic made from 401.731 wine corks. In a four day period over 30.000 people visited the mosaic in the central park in Limmen, a town with less than 7.000 inhabitants. See also https://lnkd.in/bYfYPZh and https://lnkd.in/bcUD2E9 for some video impressions.

Since its foundation in 2001 Stichting Limmen Ludiek has organised the following events (all of which were Guinness World Records at the time of completion):
2001 – largest cocktail (2001 liter) > regional record for BeNeLux
2005 – largest pyramid built with beer crates (63.365 crates)
2010 – tallest LEGO-tower (30,52 meter)
2015 - largest mosaic made from wine corks (180,96 m2 / 401.731 wine corks)

All of the events mentioned above have been made possible by hundreds of volunteers, as well as many sponsors (most of which locally based, as well as national and international sponsors). This contributes to the tight-knit connections between the inhabitants of Limmen and other communities within the Council of Castricum.

My responsibilities include managing the catering and entertainment divisions, as well as acquiring sponsors and volunteers, amongst others.

There are a number of problems that underprivileged children commonly experience in the education system. These problems include instability, inadequate life-skills training, special education needs, and cultural sensitivities. For approximately six years I helped some local underprivileged children by providing weekly tutoring, free of charge.
